Utterance: <synch>
Hi again! It’s great to see you. How have you been since our last session?
I’ve been okay, working on the meditation and the letter for my brother.
That’s wonderful to hear! How did the letter go?
I wrote it, but I haven’t sent it yet.
That’s alright. Writing it is a big step. How did it feel to express your thoughts on paper?
It felt good, but I’m nervous about sending it.
It’s understandable to feel that way. What are your concerns about sending it?
I’m worried he won’t respond, and that will hurt.
That’s a valid concern. Sometimes, people need time to process their feelings. Sending the letter could open a door for communication, even if it takes time.
I guess that makes sense.
Have you thought about how you might feel if he doesn’t respond?
I think I’d feel sad but also relieved that I reached out.
That’s a healthy perspective. It’s about expressing your care, regardless of the outcome. Would you like to set a goal for when you might send it?
Maybe by the end of this week?
That sounds like a great plan. Now, how has the meditation been going?
I’ve been doing it most nights, and it’s really helped with my sleep.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like you’re making progress. Have you noticed any changes in your overall mood?
I think I’m feeling a bit more at peace.
That’s wonderful to hear. It’s great that you’re finding ways to manage your anxiety. Have you tried any other coping strategies?
I’ve been going out for bike rides more often.
That’s excellent! Exercise can be a great way to boost your mood. How does it feel to be more active?
It feels freeing. I love being outdoors.
That’s so important. Nature has a way of refreshing our minds. Have you considered any new activities that might combine your love for the outdoors and exercise?
I’ve thought about trying kayaking.
That sounds like a fun idea! It could be a great way to explore new areas. Would you like to set a goal to try kayaking sometime?
Yes, I think I’ll look into it for next month.
Perfect! Setting those kinds of goals can help keep you motivated. Now, how has your relationship with your friends been?
It’s been okay, but I feel a bit distant from them lately.
That’s understandable, especially with everything you’re going through. Have you been able to connect with them?
Not really. I’ve been more focused on my own stuff.
It’s okay to prioritize yourself, but maintaining those connections can also be beneficial. Would you like to think about ways to reconnect with them?
Maybe I could invite them for a bike ride.
That’s a great idea! It’s a casual way to spend time together. How do you think they’d respond?
I think they’d be excited.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like a good opportunity to strengthen those friendships. As we wrap up, is there anything else you want to discuss today?
I think we’ve covered a lot again.
I agree! You’ve made some great progress. Remember to send that letter and consider your biking plans. I look forward to hearing how it all goes next time!
Thank you, Ellie.
You’re welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next week.
Goodbye!
Goodbye!
